Chatterbox.name: Chatterbox
Chatterbox.description:
This is an alternate thing for the UI module.
Chatterbox is basically a thing.

dAmn.Extension.name: dAmn.Extension
dAmn.Extension.description:
The dAmn extension makes the client work with dAmn. This extension also implements
various other features to improve on the user experience.

dAmn.avatar.name: dAmn.avatar
dAmn.avatar.description: This object provides a few helper functions relating to deviantART avatars.

TablumpString.name: TablumpString
TablumpString.description:
Represents a string that possibly contains tablumps.
Use different object methods to render the tablumps differently.

params.name: parser
params.description: A reference to a tablumps parser. Not required.

UI.name: UI
UI.description:
This object is the platform for the wsc UI. Everything can be used and
loaded from here.

params.name: view
params.description: Base jQuery object to use for the UI. Any empty div will do.

params.name: options
params.description: Custom settings to use for the UI.

params.name: mozilla
params.description: Is the browser in use made by Mozilla?

Channel.name: Channel
Channel.description:
Chat channel object.
Manages channel events and data, and acts as a thin wrapper for the
channel's UI object.

params.name: ns
params.description: The name of the channel this object will represent.

params.name: hidden
params.description: Should the channel's tab be visible?

Chatbook.name: Chatbook
Chatbook.description: Object for managing the chatbook portion of the UI.

Control.name: Control
Control.description: Controls the input panel of the client.

Navigation.name: Navigation
Navigation.description: Navigation UI element. Provides helpers for controlling the chat navigation.

Popup.name: Popup
Popup.description:
Popup window base class.
Should allow people to easily create popups... or something.
Subclasses of the popups should provide a way of closing the popup, or
maybe I could change things around a bit so there's always a close button in
the top right corner. That said, the settings window looks good with the
close button at the bottom. Maybe make that configurable. Use a flag to
determine whether or not this class applies the close function or not?

Settings.name: Settings
Settings.description:
Settings popup window.
Provides stuff for doing things. Yay.

Settings.Config.name: Settings.Config
Settings.Config.description:
Settings options object.
Extensions can configure the settings window with this shit yo.

Settings.Item.name: Settings.Item
Settings.Item.description: A base class for settings page items.

params.name: type
params.description: Determines the type of the item.

template.name: template
template.description: Container object for HTML5 templates for the chat UI.

Client.name: Client
Client.description:
An entire chat client. Instances of this object orchestrate the operation of
the client. Other objects are loaded in to control different parts of the client. These
components can be reasonably swapped out, assuming they provide the same functionality.

Flow.name: Flow
Flow.description: Control the client's program flow in relation to the chat this.

Transport.name: Transport
Transport.description:
Client transport.
Acts as a basic wrapper around a transport.

This method will be called when

params.name: message

When a message is received
  on the transport, this method will be called.

params.name: disconnect
params.description:
The method to be
  called when the connection has been closed.

classitems.name:
html

Render the tablumps as HTML entities.

text

Render the tablumps in plain text where possible. Some tablumps appear as
HTML entities even through this.

ansi

Render the tablumps with ANSI escape sequences.

For this rendering method to really be worth it, I'll actually have to move
away from the simple regex.

classitems.description: States for the parser.

classitems.object:
wsc.dAmn.TablumpParser

Constructor for the tablumps parser.

classitems.name:
registerMap

I should probably deprecate this. Sets the rendering map to the given map.

extend

Add the given rendering items to the parser's render map.

defaultMap

Get all the default nonsense.

parse

Create a wsc.dAmn.TablumpString obejct and return it.

tokenise

Parse a message possibly containing tablumps into tokens.

render

Render tablumps in a given format.

Here, the flag should be a number, and defines the index of the renderer
to use when rendering a tablump. Setting `flag` to 0 will result in the
first renderer being used. In the render map, the plain text renderers come
first, and also act as a default.

Setting `flag` to 1 causes the parser to render tablumps as HTML elements
where possible. Setting `flag` to 2 causes the parser to render tablumps as
ANSI escape sequence formatted strings where possible.

classitems.description: Load configuration from localStorage.
classitems.name: config_load

classitems.description: Save configuration save localStorage.
classitems.name: config_save

classitems.description:
Build the client interface and hook up any required event handlers for the
interface. In particular, event handlers are hooked for switching and
closing channel tabs.
classitems.name: build

classitems.description:
Called every now and then.
Does stuff like clear channels of excess log messages.
Maybe this is something that the UI lib should handle.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description: Add an extension to the client.
classitems.name: add_extension

classitems.description: Bind a method to an event.
classitems.name: bind

params.name: event
params.description: Name of the event to listen for.

params.name: handler
params.description: Method to call when the given event is triggered.

classitems.description: Clear event listeners for a given event.
classitems.name: clear_listeners

classitems.description: Trigger an event.
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: event
params.description: Name of the event to trigger.

classitems.description: Add a middleware method.
classitems.name: middle

classitems.description: Run a method with middleware.
classitems.name: cascade

classitems.description:
Open a connection to the chat server.
If the client if already connected, nothing happens.
classitems.name: connect

classitems.description: Close the connection foo.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description: Get or set the channel object associated with the given namespace.
classitems.name: channel

params.name: namespace
params.description: Channel namespace to get or set.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel object to use for the given namespace.

return.description: Channel object associated with the given namespace.

classitems.description:
Get a count of the number of channels the client has open.
Channels with their tabs hidden are not counted.
classitems.name: channels

params.name: names
params.description: Return the names of the open channels?

classitems.description: Iterate through the different channels.
classitems.name: each_channel

params.name: method
params.description: Function to call for each channel.

classitems.description: Deform a channel namespace to its shorthand form.
classitems.name: deform_ns

classitems.description: Format a channel namespace in its longhand form.
classitems.name: format_ns

classitems.description: Create a channel object for the client.
classitems.name: create_ns

params.name: namespace
params.description: Namespace to use for the channel.

params.name: hidden
params.description: Should the channel tab be hidden?

classitems.description: Remove a channel object from the client.
classitems.name: remove_ns

params.name: namespace
params.description: Namespace of the channel to remove.

classitems.description: Write a log message to a channel's log view.
classitems.name: log

params.name: namespace
params.description: Namespace of the channel to log to.

classitems.description: Write a message to the client monitor.
classitems.name: monitor

classitems.description: Mute a user.
classitems.name: mute_user

classitems.description: Unmute a user.
classitems.name: unmute_user

classitems.description: Send a packet to the server.
classitems.name: send

return.description:
Number of characters written to the server.
  -1 for failure.

classitems.description: Send a handshake packet.
classitems.name: handshake

classitems.description: Send a login packet.
classitems.name: login

classitems.description: Send a pong packet to the server.
classitems.name: pong

classitems.description: Join a channel.
classitems.name: join

classitems.description: Leave a channel.
classitems.name: part

classitems.description: Send a message to a channel.
classitems.name: say

params.name: namespace
params.description: Channel to send a message to.

classitems.description: Send a non-parsed message to a channel.
classitems.name: npmsg

params.name: namespace
params.description: Channel to send a message to.

classitems.description: Send an action message to a channel.
classitems.name: action

params.name: namespace
params.description: Channel to send a message to.

classitems.description: Promote a user in a channel.
classitems.name: promote

params.name: pc
params.description: Privclass to promote the user to.

classitems.description: Demote a user in a channel.
classitems.name: demote

params.name: pc
params.description: Privclass to demote the user to.

classitems.description: Ban a user from a channel.
classitems.name: ban

classitems.description: Unban a user from a channel.
classitems.name: unban

classitems.description: Kick a user from a channel.
classitems.name: kick

classitems.description:
Kill a user's connection to the server.
Only message network admins have access to this packet on the server.
classitems.name: kill

classitems.description: Send an admin comment to a channel.
classitems.name: admin

params.name: namespace
params.description: Channel to use for the admin command.

classitems.description: Request a channel property from the server.
classitems.name: property

params.name: namespace
params.description: Namespace of the channel to get a property for.

params.name: property
params.description: Name of the property to get.

classitems.description: Set a channel property.
classitems.name: set

params.name: namespace
params.description: Namespace of the channel to set a property for.

params.name: property
params.description:
Name of the property to set. Should be 'title' or
  'topic'.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set the property to.

classitems.description: Get whois information for a user.
classitems.name: whois

classitems.description: Send a disconnect packet.
classitems.name: disconnect

classitems.description: This extension implements most of the default commands for wsc.

classitems.name: setter
classitems.cmd:
set set configuration options
This command allows the user to change the settings for the client through
the input box.

classitems.name:
connect
This command allows the user to force the client to connect to the server.

classitems.description: Steal the lime light. Brings the cursor to the input panel.
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description: Set the input handlers for the input panel.
classitems.name: set_input

classitems.description: Save current input in a cache.
classitems.name: cache_input

classitems.description:
Get a channel's input history object.
If no history object exists for the given channel, a new object is created
and stored.
classitems.name: get_history

params.name: namespace
params.description:
Channel to get the history of. If not given, the
  channel currently being viewed is used.

classitems.description: Append an item to the current channel's input history.
classitems.name: append_history

classitems.description: Scroll through the current channel's input history.
classitems.name: scroll_history

classitems.description: Handle the tab character being pressed.
classitems.name: tab_item

classitems.description:
Start tab complete capabilities by compiling a list of items that match the
current user input.
classitems.name: start_tab

classitems.description: Clear the tabbing cache.
classitems.name: end_tab

classitems.description: Handle the send button being pressed.
classitems.name: submit

classitems.description: A keypress happened. Process the keypress biatch.
classitems.name: keypress

classitems.description: Handle some user input.
classitems.name: handle

params.name: data
params.description: Input message given by the user.

classitems.description: Handle a packet event.
classitems.name: handle

classitems.description: Respond to pings from the server.
classitems.name: ping

classitems.description: Respond to a llama-style handshake.
classitems.name: chatserver

classitems.description: Process a login packet
classitems.name: login

classitems.description: Received a join packet.
classitems.name: join

classitems.description: Received a part packet.
classitems.name: part

classitems.description: Client has been kicked from a channel.
classitems.name: kicked

classitems.description: Process a property packet.
classitems.name: property

classitems.description: User join or part.
classitems.name: recv_joinpart

classitems.description: A user joined a channel.
classitems.name: recv_join

classitems.description: A user left a channel.
classitems.name: recv_part

classitems.description: A message was received in a channel.
classitems.name: recv_msg

classitems.description: A different kind of message.
classitems.name: recv_action

classitems.description: A non-parsed message.
classitems.name: recv_npmsg

classitems.description: Someone was promoted or demoted.
classitems.name: recv_privchg

classitems.description: Some sucka got kicked foo.
classitems.name: recv_kicked

classitems.description:
Ignore extension.

Implements the ignore functionality.
Sets. Yeah. Fun.

Rendered message object.

classitems.name:
text

Render the tablumps in plain text where possible. Some tablumps appear as
HTML entities even through this.

ansi

Render the tablumps with ANSI escape sequences.

For this rendering method to really be worth it, I'll actually have to move
away from the simple regex.
